ResourceHeader.Description: The TIDE Website contains information about the instrument, its operation, its level-zero data, and its processing software. Users can view spectrogram summary plots and interactively process TIDE level-zero data for the entire Polar Mission (03/28/96 through 04/16/08). Only the major webpages are discussed below. There are several other links on the home page. There are mirror sites at the National Space Science and Technology Center (NSSTC) and GSFC.

InformationURL.Name: GSFC TIDE Home Page
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Home Page contains links to all available information about the instrument, its data and software, summary plot viewing, interactive data processing (Custom Plots and Data Dumps), mission information, and documentation about the website, data, and the processing software.

InformationURL.Name: GSFC TIDE Summary Plot Gifwalk
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Summary Plot Gifwalk lets the user scan through TIDE high time resolution spectrogram plots for the entire Polar mission. The user selects the ion type: Total (Ion), H+, O+, or He+; the year, month, and day to start the viewing; the spectrogram type: half-orbit, perigee, 6-hr PSI operations, or plasmasphere passes; and then presses Update Date/Type/Ion. Once the gif image is displayed, there are arrow keys that allow the user to move forward and backward in time. The user can download the gif by right click / save picture as or click on Download the pdf version to see and download the higher quality pdf plot. There is a TIDE Website navigation bar at the bottom of the webpage. The user can zoom in on an area of interest by clicking on the image at that point. That takes the user to the High Time Resolution Spectrogram Custom Plot Webpage, where after changing any default processing options and Submitting Request, a new spectrogram plot will be created.

InformationURL.Name: GSFC TIDE View Thumbnails
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Thumbnails webpage provides a way to view several TIDE summary spectrograms quickly. Just specify the time range and select the ion and the spectrogram type (either half-orbit or perigee) and submit request. Thumbnails of each spectrogram in the time range are displayed 8 per row. Move the mouse over a thumbnail to get the start time of the plot. Click on the thumbnail to view the full size gif and get a link to the pdf.

InformationURL.Name: GSFC TIDE Custom Plots
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Custom Plots website allows users to process TIDE level-zero data for several different plot types including 1-D and 2-D spectrograms, phase space density velocity distributions, moments (density, velocity, and temperature), phase space density versus velocity, chromograms, and Polar orbit. Once the processing is complete, the user can download the plots (gif, postscript, and/or pdf). If the plot is associated with a text file containing the results (moments, velocity distributions, and psd vs. velocity), then there will be a download link for that file. See http://tideuviRA.nsstc.nasa.gov/tide/Documentation/ProcessingSoftware/ProSoft.html or http://tide.gsfc.nasa.gov/Documentation/ProcessingSoftware/ProSoft.html for details about each processing type.

InformationURL.Name: GSFC TIDE Data Dumps
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Data Dumps webpage allows users to download text files or plots of certain types of data including engineering/housekeeping text dump or summary plots, instrument parameters, magnetic field location, spin header information, major frame byte dump, and dumps of raw and processed counts/flux. Once the processing is complete, the user can download the requested datafile or plots. See http://tideuviRA.nsstc.nasa.gov/tide/Documentation/ProcessingSoftware/ProSoft.html or http://tide.gsfc.nasa.gov/Documentation/ProcessingSoftware/ProSoft.html for details about each plot type.

InformationURL.Name: GSFC TIDE Data Download
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Data Download webpage allows the user to download the files required by the TIDE processing software including TIDE level-zero data files and ion mask files and Polar orbit, attitude, and spacecraft potential files.

InformationURL.Name: GSFC TIDE Software Download
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Software Download webpage is used to download the latest version of the IDL-based TIDE processing software. The site includes links to installation instructions and a link to the processing software documentation.

InformationURL.Name: GSFC TIDE Mission Documentation
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Mission Documentation website documentations of all aspects of the Polar/TIDE Mission including the level-zero processing software, instrument operations and commanding, the website, the data archive, the datafiles, and miscellaneous information.

AccessURL.Name: NSSTC TIDE Home Page
AccessURL.Description: The TIDE Home Page contains links to all available information about the instrument, its data and software, summary plot viewing, interactive data processing (Custom Plots and Data Dumps), mission information, and documentation about the website, data, and the processing software.
